maml:description.maml:para: Add an element.

Adds the specified element to the network list. If the network list's type is `IP`, the value needs to be a URL-encoded IP address or CIDR block. If the type is `GEO`, it's a two-character country code.
Your network list's ID.
An element to add to the network list.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
An element to add to the network list.
Your network list's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Get a network list.
Gets all network lists or retrieves a specific network list by its ID. When listing all, you can filter the results by name with the `-Search` parameter or by type with the `-ListType` parameter.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network list's deployment status in both `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` environments. This data takes longer to provide.
When enabled, the response `list` includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and show large response objects.
If provided, filters the output to list only the given type of network lists, either `IP` or `GEO`. This corresponds to the network list object's type member.
Lists only items that match the specified substring in any network list's name or list of items.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network list's deployment status in both `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` environments. This data takes longer to provide.
When enabled, the response `list` includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and show large response objects.
Your network list's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network list's deployment status in both `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` environments. This data takes longer to provide.
When enabled, the response `list` includes all items. For large network lists, this may slow responses and show large response objects.
If provided, filters the output to list only the given type of network lists, either `IP` or `GEO`. This corresponds to the network list object's type member.
Your network list's ID.
Lists only items that match the specified substring in any network list's name or list of items.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Get activation details.

Provides detailed information on the status of a given activation, including progress on fast activation and other audit information. To get the standard activation status information, run the `Get-NetworkListActivationStatus` operation.
Your activation request's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your activation request's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Get activation status.

Shows a network list's activation status on either the staging or production environment. The response reflects standard activation status. To get the fast activation status information, run the `Get-NetworkListActivation` operation.
Your network list's ID.
The Akamai network on which this list is activated, either `STAGING` or `PRODUCTION`.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The Akamai network on which this list is activated, either `STAGING` or `PRODUCTION`.
Your network list's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Get an activation's snapshot.
Gets a version of a network list in its state when activated, with each version identified by its `-SyncPoint` value. You can only get `syncPoint` versions that have been activated.
Your network list's ID.
The network list version for which to retrieve the snapshot. This corresponds to the `syncPoint` the API exchanges for each successive modification to the network list.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network list's deployment status in both `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` environments. This data takes longer to provide.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

When enabled, provides additional response data identifying who created and updated the list and when, and the network list's deployment status in both `STAGING` and `PRODUCTION` environments. This data takes longer to provide.
Your network list's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
The network list version for which to retrieve the snapshot. This corresponds to the `syncPoint` the API exchanges for each successive modification to the network list.
Create a network list.
Creates a new network list. You can specify attributes individually or all at once with the `-Body` parameter.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your contract's ID
Additional information about the network list.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The ID of the group for which you want to create the list. You need to have write access to the group you specify. If you include the `-GroupID`, you need to pair it with the `-ContractID`.
The name of the network list.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
The network list type, either `IP` for IP addresses and CIDR blocks, or `GEO` for two-letter country codes.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your contract's ID
Additional information about the network list.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The ID of the group for which you want to create the list. You need to have write access to the group you specify. If you include the `-GroupID`, you need to pair it with the `-ContractID`.
The name of the network list.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
The network list type, either `IP` for IP addresses and CIDR blocks, or `GEO` for two-letter country codes.
Activate a network list.
Activates the most recent `syncPoint` version of a network list on either the staging or production environment.
Your network list's ID.
The Akamai network on which this list is activated, either `STAGING` or `PRODUCTION`.
Descriptive text to accompany the activation. This is reflected in the activation object's `activationComments` member.
A list of email addresses of Control Center users who receive an email when activation of the list is complete. Don't add addresses to the list without the recipients' consents.
If the activation is linked to a Siebel ticket, this identifies the ticket.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Descriptive text to accompany the activation. This is reflected in the activation object's `activationComments` member.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The Akamai network on which this list is activated, either `STAGING` or `PRODUCTION`.
Your network list's ID.
A list of email addresses of Control Center users who receive an email when activation of the list is complete. Don't add addresses to the list without the recipients' consents.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
If the activation is linked to a Siebel ticket, this identifies the ticket.
Subscribe to network lists.
Specifies a set of email addresses to inform Control Center account recipients about changes to a set of network lists.
A full set of email addresses, at least one, that receive notifications about any changes to the network lists specified in `-UniquedIDs`.
A full set of network list identifiers, at least one, the recipients are notified about.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
A full set of email addresses, at least one, that receive notifications about any changes to the network lists specified in `-UniquedIDs`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
A full set of network list identifiers, at least one, the recipients are notified about.
Delete a network list.

Removes a network list. You can only remove network lists that have never been activated. To deactivate a list, you can empty its `list` of elements by running the `Remove-NetworkListElement` operation.
Your network list's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Your network list's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Remove an element.
Removes the specified element from the list. If the network list's type is `IP`, the value is a URL-encoded IP address or CIDR block. If the type is `GEO`, it's a two-character country code.
Your network list's ID.
An element to add to the network list.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
An element to add to the network list.
Your network list's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Unsubscribe to network lists.
Unsubscribes the listed users from a set of network lists.
A full set of email addresses, at least one, that receive notifications about any changes to the network lists specified in `-UniquedIDs`.
A full set of network list identifiers, at least one, the recipients are notified about.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

A full set of network list identifiers, at least one, the recipients are notified about.
Update a network list.

Modifies the network list items and properties. You can edit the name, description, and a set of network list items to the resource. You can't edit the type. When running the operation, the current state of the list is replaced with the properties and items you provide.

> Note: To retrieve a network list with its elements, run the `Get-NetworkList` operation with the `-NetworkListID` parameter and the `-IncludeElements` switch, edit the content locally, and pipe it to this command. Make sure to use the `-IncludeElements` switch when retrieving. Otherwise, the operation won't return any elements.
Your network list's ID.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Your network list's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
